isaInvestigation.title: Investigation
isaInvestigation.description: Created using the MetaboLights Online Editor (MOE)

studies.title: Limited nutrient availability in the tumor microenvironment renders pancreatic tumors sensitive to allosteric IDH1 inhibitors
studies.description: Nutrient-deprived conditions in the tumor microenvironment (TME) restrain cancer cell viability due to increased free radicals and reduced energy production. In pancreatic cancer cells, a cytosolic metabolic enzyme, wild-type isocitrate dehydrogenase 1 (wtIDH1), enables the adaptation to these conditions. Under nutrient starvation, wtIDH1 oxidizes isocitrate to generate α-ketoglutarate (αKG) for anaplerosis, and NADPH to support antioxidant defense. In this study, we show that allosteric inhibitors of mutant IDH1 (mIDH1) are potent wtIDH1 inhibitors under conditions present in the TME. We demonstrate that low magnesium levels facilitate allosteric inhibition of wtIDH1, which is lethal to cancer cells when nutrients are limited. Furthermore, the FDA-approved mIDH1 inhibitor ivosidenib (AG-120) dramatically inhibited tumor growth in preclinical models of pancreatic cancer, highlighting this approach as a potential therapeutic strategy against wild-type IDH1 cancers.

protocols.name: Sample collection
protocols.description:
Cell lines, cell culture and reagents

MiaPaCa-2 pancreatic cancer cells were obtained from ATCC (American Type Culture Collection) with catalog no. CRL-1420. Mycoplasma screening was performed using a MycoAlert detection kit (Lonza). Cell lines were maintained at 37 °C and 5% CO2. For standard cell culture, cells were grown in DMEM containing 25 mM glucose and 4 mM glutamine, and supplemented with 10% FBS, 1% penicillin/streptomycin and prophylactic doses of plasmocin (Life Technologies, MPP-01-03) to prevent mycoplasma infection. Glucose withdrawal was performed to simulate low glucose conditions in pancreatic cancer microenvironment. For low-glucose experiments, glucose-free DMEM (Life Technologies, 21013-024) was supplemented with 2.5 mM glucose, 10% FBS and penicillin-streptomycin.


CRISPR/Cas9 editing of IDH1 in pancreatic cancer cells

IDH1-knockout was performed using a gRNA: GTAGATCCAATTCCACGTAGGG (Sigma, target ID, HS0000323225). A negative control plasmid (CRISPR06-1EA) was used in isogenic cells. Plasmid transfections were performed with lipofectamine 2000 (Life technology, 11668-027). After 48 h, EGFP-expressing cells were sorted by flow cytometry. Clones from parental cell line were expanded, and genomic DNA and protein were extracted for verification of IDH1 deletion. Herein, cells with IDH1 deletion and isogenic controls are referred to as IDH1-/- and IDH1+/+, respectively.


Metabolic profiling

IDH1+/+ and IDH1-/- cells under glucose withdrawal (2.5 mM glucose, 4 mM glutamine supplemented with 10% dialyzed FBS) for 48 h (individual biological replicates: IDH1+/+, n = 4; IDH1-/-, n = 3).

protocols.name: Extraction
protocols.description: When the metabolites are ready to collect, cells were washed with cold PBS and residual extracellular media/PBS was completely removed from cell cultures. While plates on ice, 1 mL cold MeOH (80%) was added per well. After 10 min, the cell lysates were completely collected using a cell scraper into 1.5 mL tubes. The tubes were centrifuged at top speed, 4 °C for 5 min. The supernatant was transferred into another tube. A separate well was used to measure protein content for normalization.

protocols.name: Chromatography
protocols.description: LC-MS analyses were performed using an Agilent Technologies Triple Quad 6470 LC-MS/MS system with a 1290 Infinity II LC Flexible Pump (Quaternary Pump), 1290 Infinity II Multisampler and 1290 Infinity II Multicolumn Thermostat with 6 port valve. An Agilent ZORBAX RRHD Extend-C18, 2.1 x 150 mm, 1.8 um and ZORBAX Extend Fast Guards for UHPLC were used for separation. Solvent A was 97% water and 3% methanol 15 mM acetic acid and 10 mM tributylamine at pH 5. Solvent C was 15 mM acetic acid and 10 mM tributylamine in methanol. Washing Solvent D was acetonitrile. LC system seal washing solvent was 90% water and 10% isopropanol. Needle wash solvent was 50% methanol, 25% water. The LC gradient profile was as follows: 0.25 mL/min; 0.0-2.5 min, 100% A; 7.5 min, 80% A and 20% C; 13.0 min, 55% A and 45% C; 20.0 min, 1% A and 99% C; 24.0 min, 1% A and 99% C; 24.05 min, 1% A and 99% D; 27.0 min, 1% A and 99% D; 0.8 mL/min; 27.50-31.35 min, 1% A and 99% D; 0.6 mL/min; 31.5 min, 1% A and 99% D; 0.4 mL/min; 32.25-39.90 min, 100% A; 0.25 mL/min; 40.0 min, 100% A. Column temp was kept at 35 °C, samples at 4 °C and injection volume at 2 μL.

protocols.name: Mass spectrometry
protocols.description:
The 6470 Triple Quad MS was calibrated with ESI-L Low concentration Tuning mix. Source parameters were as follows: Gas temp, 150 °C; Gas flow, 10 L/min; Nebulizer, 45 psi; Sheath gas temp, 325 °C; Sheath gas flow, 12 L/min; Capillary, -2000 V; Delta EMV, -200 V. Dynamic MRM scan type was used with 0.07 min peak width and 24.0 min acquisition time. dMRM transitions and other parameters for each compound are listed below. Delta retention time of plus and minus 1.0 min, fragmentor of 40 eV and cell accelerator of 5 eV were incorporated in the method. Agilent Masshunter Workstation software LC-MS Data Acquisition for 6400 Series Triple Quadrupole MS with Version B.08.02 is used for calibration, compound optimization and sample data acquisition.


LCMS-grade acetic acid Optima (Fisher Chemical), InfinityLab Deactivator additive (5191-4506), ESI-L Low concentration Tuning mix (Agilent Technologies), LCMS grade solvents of water, and acetonritele, methanol (Millipore), isopropanol (Fisher Chemical). For Ion paring (IP) stock solution preparation: 450 mL methanol + 35.8 mL TBA + 12.9 acetic acid. For A: 1000 mL LCMS water + 1034 μL of deactivator + 34.25 IP stock solution. For B, 1000 mL LCMS methanol + 1034 μL of deactivator + 34.25 IP stock solution.

protocols.name: Data transformation
protocols.description: Agilent MassHunter Workstation software LC-MS Data Acquisition for 6400 Series Triple Quadrupole MS (version B.08.02) was used for compound optimization and sample data acquisition. Agilent MassHunter Quantitative Analysis (version B.09.00) QqQ software was used to integrate and quantitate areas.

protocols.name: Metabolite identification
protocols.description: Targeted analysis/identification based on Agilent targeted library and MRMs.
